context_of_use: The customer accesses the order tracking feature through the system interface.
scope: Order tracking functionality within the e-commerce platform.
description: Allow customers to view the status and delivery progress of their orders.
triggering_event: Customer initiates the order tracking process.
preconditions: Customer has placed at least one order.
Customer is logged into their account.
postconditions: Customer receives the current status of their orders.
Customer can view estimated delivery dates.
assumptions: The system has access to real-time order status information.
The customer has a stable internet connection.
requirements_met: The system must provide order tracking functionality.
The system must display accurate order status.
outstanding_issues: Potential delays in updating order status information.
main_flow: 1. Customer selects the 'Track Orders' option → System displays the list of orders.
2. Customer selects a specific order → System retrieves and displays the order status and delivery progress.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If no orders are found, the system displays a message indicating that there are no orders to track.
information_for_steps: 1. Order data including order ID, status, and delivery information.
2. Customer account information to verify identity.
